Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000709

License #: CP500201269
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Tishara Price
Agency Name: MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 44777 N Gratiot Ave
Clinton Township, MI 48036-1362
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/20/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Care Worker flirted with the father of Youth A and Youth B.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 5/21/2025. Complainant
stated Foster Care Worker did not flirt with Father, but Father
attempted to flirt with Foster Care Worker. Complainant reported
she wanted the agency to change the case worker due to the
Father's attraction to Foster Care Worker. Complainant reported
Father stated he was attracted to Foster Care Worker, and he
attempted to flirt with Foster Care Worker.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor by phone on 5/21/2025.
Foster Care Supervisor reported Foster Care Worker did not flirt
with Father, but Foster Care Worker had notified Foster Care
Supervisor that Father had flirted with Foster Care Worker. Foster
Care Supervisor stated Foster Care Worker responded
appropriately to Father's comments.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 5/22/2025. Foster
Care Worker denied flirting with Father of the children but reported
Father had attempted to flirt with Foster Care Worker. Foster
Care Worker stated she did not reciprocate the attempt and
reported the incident to Foster Care Supervisor. Foster Care
Worker stated she had text message documentation related to the
incident and she would send that information to me. Foster Care
Worker stated she did not have any direct contact with Father as
communication had been through text messages and video chat
contact only.
Three attempts were made to contact Father to confirm the
content of Father’s text messages, but Father was unresponsive.
Two messages were left on 08/05/2025 and a third message on
08/07/2025 requesting Father to call/contact this consultant;
however, Father failed to return contact.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the text messages between Foster Care Worker and
Father. Father stated in one text message related to whether he
would be able to attend a scheduled meeting, "Oh yes I love
seeing u and I will definitely be there." Foster Care Worker
responded to the line of texts by stating “Okay” and “Are you able
to log on?”
2

In another text message exchange where Foster Care Worker
was reporting Foster Care Worker would no longer be supervising
video chats, Father responded by stating, "I hope it's not my fault
that u will no longer be supervising the video chats." Foster Care
Worker responded that it was easier for foster parents and Father
responded, "But yes I wanted to make sure because sometimes I
catch myself flirting with u and I know that's wrong but I can't help
it so I just wanted to make sure I wasn't the reason." Foster Care
Worker responded within this line of texts by stating, “Reminder
that your virtual visit with the boys is today at 6:30, so 5:30 your
time, foster parent sent you the link in your email. In response to
your text I just want to remind you that we have a strictly
professional relationship.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance per staff and complainant
interviews that were completed and text documentation that was
reviewed. Agency staff denied the allegation and Complainant
stated the flirtation was from Father and not from Foster Care
Worker. The content of text messages reviewed supports this
determination.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
07/28/2025
______________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 12, 2025
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
WOC Area Manager
3
